results.title: Peripheral Produce: all time greatest hits
results.brief_description: Peripheral Produce defines itself as a “as a propaganda machine that promotes underground cinematic endeavours.” It began as a monthly screening series of independent and experimental short film and video works in Portland, Oregon in 1996 and soon after set up a distribution arm to disseminate these works. This, their tenth release is a “best of” collection of works made between 1998 and 2002. “Getting stronger every day” explores the imaginative life of children in mundanely poignant tableaux where the spirit realm manifests in lo-tech effects and remembered TV movies. “Wustenspringmaus” is a quirky documentary about wily rodent of the title, also known as the gerbil. “The Subconscious art of graffiti removal” is a keen observation about visual aesthetics of graffiti removal that reveals how the destruction of one art form unwittingly creates another. “Stuffing” is a found footage video juxtaposing images to create humorous and absurd associations. In “Removed” an old pornographic film is manipulated using nail polish and bleach, to erase the image of the woman from the scene. “Election collectables” is a faux-recreation of a home shopping network where presidential candidates spruik collectables commemorating the 2000 elections. “N Judah 5:30” captures fleeting images of tired commuters. “Oona’s veil” is a study in celluloid decomposition using a strip of film from a screen test. “Crowdog” is a personal documentary in which the filmmaker recalls events that took place during the years in her teens when she stopped wearing shoes. “Buffalo Common” documents the dismantling of the ballistic missile industry in North Dakota - leaving the state to reconsider its already pessimistic future.

results.title: Periodicity I
results.brief_description: “Summary: discusses the linear graph and the discrete graph. gives examples of various periodic functions and shows their time graphs”
results.description: “Summary: discusses the linear graph and the discrete graph. gives examples of various periodic functions and shows their time graphs”

results.title: Periodic motions
results.brief_description: A discussion of periodic motions by Patterson Hume and Donald Ivey, considering mainly simple harmonic motion. Demonstrates a self-plotted displacement time graph from which graphs of velocity and acceleration versus time are derived. Explains the derivation of the formula for the period of simple harmonic motion and demonstrates dynamics and period.

results.title: Perilous Voyage
results.creator_credit: Yorkshire Television, Oliver Hunkin and Len Lurcuck
results.brief_description: Sir Michael Hordern, in the guise of Homer himself, narrates this animated version (in 6 parts) of Homer’s Odyssey! The adaptation is by Oliver Hunkin, one time Eton College classical tutor, who has attempted to present it as the great epic poem it is, and to recapture something of the surge and thunder of the original. Graphic artist, Alan Parry, studied the gods and goddesses, the heroes and monsters portrayed on ancient Greek vases, before beginning work on the series.

results.title: Perigord cuisine
results.creator_credit: BCD France - TV Ontario Canada and Regis Dervelle
results.brief_description: Provides an overview of the cuisine of the Perigord region in France. Shows the harvesting of the food items used as ingredients. Presents a demostration on how to cook some dishes from the region including scrambled eggs with truffles, truffle feullette, and mousse de foie gras covered with ham and flaky pastry.

results.title: Perhaps you've noticed you're changing
results.brief_description: Dicusses the bodily changes that occur in females at puberty. Uses computer graphics to explain the functions of the reproductive organs and the menstrual process. Also indicates the changes that occur in boys at puberty and illustrates, by a diagram, how conception occurs. Contains some low key comercial promotion.

results.title: Perfumes of France
results.brief_description: The famous perfume of France, from flower to bottle. The cultivation of flower around Grasse in the south of France and the extraction of the essential oils; blending and testing of new perfumes; bottling and marketing the great perfumes.

results.title: Performance appraisal: the human dynamics
results.brief_description: This film looks at the performance appraisal in everyday situations, including work. Dr. Alex Rosen, a specialist in organisational performance appraisal talks about the subject and sites that a number of organizations have experimented with a variety of performance appraisal systems, in an attempt to make a valuation of work performance a more productive experience.

results.title: Performance appraisal and personal development
results.brief_description: The principal aim of this video is to provide viewers with the knowledge and understanding of a performance appraisal system, the need for a positive and active role in the process and how the system will develop their performance and career prospects within an organisation. A manual accompanies this video and may be borrowed as a separate loan item.
